7: { "Female Tigers": {  "Age":{   "short_description":"Age",   "data_type":"Integer",   "initial_value":"1"  },  "Fertile?":{   "short_description":"True/False",   "data_type":"Boolean",   "initial_value":"True"  },  "Gestating?":{   "short_description":"True/False",   "data_type":"Boolean",   "initial_value":"True"  } }}Answer by: Nnamdi UdegbunamI will like to contribute my quota to the problem at hand by presenting you with this piece of mind boggling Python code. I believe it would serve its purpose as you intend:def analyse_abm_text(abm_text):    """Extracts abm_text of the provided ABM."""    # Define dictionary for returning output as specified    out = {}    # Define variables using regular expression    regex = re.compile(r"^(\S+)\s+.*")    # Iterate over each line in the ABM text    for i,line in enumerate(abm_text):        # Match current line against regex pattern        match = regex.search(line)        # Extract the required information for the current line using group function        if match:            var_name = match.group(1).strip()            out[var_name] = {}            short_desc = None            data_type = None            init_val = None            split_line = line.split(' ')                        # Check if short description exists            for j,s in enumerate(split_line):                if s.startswith('{'):                    short_desc =''.join(split_line[j+1:j+6])                    break                        # Check if data type exists            for k,s in enumerate(split_line[::-1]):                if s.endswith('}'):                    data_type =''.join(split_line[-k-1:-k-6])[::-1]                    break                                # Check if intial value exists            for m,t in enumerate(split_line[split_line.index('{')+1:]):                if t == ':':                    init_val =''.join([l.strip() for l in split_line[m+1:m+3]])                    break                        out[var_name]['short_description'] = short_desc            out[var_name]['data_type'] = data_type            out[var_name]['initial_value'] = init_val            out[var_name]    return outQuestion: Can you provide me a simple example
